Implementation.title: Implementation
Implementation.description: Information during the performance / implementation stage of the contract.

transactions.title: Transactions
transactions.description: A list of the spending transactions made against this contract as an array of [Transaction]

milestones.title: Milestones
milestones.description: A list of milestones associated with the implementation as an array of [Milestone]

documents.title: Documents
documents.description: Documents and reports that are part of the implementation as an array on [Document]

financialProgress.title: Financial progress
financialProgress.description: The financial progress section allows high-level and detailed information on amounts committed or spent to date for this particular contract. This may be used alongside the transactions section, which allows for details of each individual payment to be recorded.

totalSpend.title: Total spend
totalSpend.description: The total spend on this contract at the date of last update published as [Value]

measures.title: Measures
measures.description: An aggregated financial progress figures for this contract. Measures must be provided as a set of key-value pairs, where the key should be the name of the measure used within a related Fiscal Data Package dataset or other budget and spending dataset. The value is the value of this measure when last updated, and must be provided as a number in the same default currency as any aggregate reported budget or spending figures.

breakdown.title: Financial progress breakdown
breakdown.description: This section contains a breakdown of financial progress, allowing various measures (amount invoiced, amount accrued, amount paid etc.) to be disaggregated by source, period and budget classification. Publishes as an array of [FinancialProgressBreakdown]

endDate.title: End date
endDate.description: The date when contract implementation ended. This must only be provided when contract implementation is complete. Where `implementation/endDate` varies from the anticipated `contract/period/endDate` an explanation of the variance should be provided in `implementation/endDateDetails`.

endDateDetails.title: End date details
endDateDetails.description: Details related to the endDate. This may be a justification for the contract's completion date being different than in the original contract.

finalValue.title: Final value
finalValue.description: The total value of all payments for a completed contract. This should only be provided when the final payment has been recorded. If `implementation/transactions` are used for this contract, this field should equal the sum of the `transaction/value/amount` fields. Where `finalValue/amount` varies from `contract/value/amount` an explanation of the variance should be provided in `finalValueDetails`. Publishes as [Value]

finalValueDetails.title: Final  value details
finalValueDetails.description: Details related to the final value. This may be a justification for the completed contract's value being different than in the original contract.

performanceFailures.title: Performance failure disclosures
performanceFailures.description: An array of [PerformanceFailure] disclosures, detailing performance failures for different periods and categories.

metrics.title: Metrics
metrics.description: Reported results from the delivery of the contracted goods, works or services described with an array of [Metrics]

status.title: Implementation status
status.descrition: The current status of the contract implementation based on the implementationStatuscodelist.

Enquiry.title: Enquiry
Enquiry.description: Question related to this contracting process, generally sent during the enquiry period.

id.title: Identifier
id.description: A unique identifier for the enquiry.

date.title: Date
date.description: The date the enquiry was received or processed.

author.title: Question author
author.description: The [OrganizationReference] of the party asking this question.

title.title: Question title
title.description: The subject line of the question.

description.title: Description
description.description: The body of the question.

answer.title: Answer
answer.description: The answer to this question, when available.

dateAnswered.title: Date answered
dateAnswered.description: The date the answer to the question was provided.

relatedItem.title: Related item
relatedItem.description: If this question relates to a specific line-item, this field contains the line-item identifier.

relatedLot.title: Related lot
relatedLot.description: Where lots are used, if this question relates to a specific lot, this field contains the lot identifier.

threadID.title: Thread identifier
threadID.description: If this question and answer forms part of a discussion thread (e.g. the question is a follow up to a previous answer) an optional thread identifier can be used to associate together multiple enquiries.

Metric.title: Metric
Metric.description: Metrics are used to set out targets and results from a contracting process. During the planning and tender sections, a metric indicates the anticipated results. In award and contract sections it indicates the awarded/contracted results. In the implementation section it is used to provide updates on actually delivered results, also known as outputs.

id.description: An identifier for this metric drawn from a codelist

description.description: Any free-text description from PE while preparing this metric of forecast

relatesTo.description: The schema element that the metric relates. For example observation may be defined against items or against lot.

relatedItem.description: This field must be populated with the id of the item in this tender section which the metric relates to

observations.description: Where known, Procuring Entity can put an allocation of aggregated budget against needed items

id.title: Identifier
id.description: An identifier for this metric. In some cases this may be drawn from a codelist of metrics required for this type of contracting process, or in other instances may be an arbitrary identifier.

description.title: Description
description.description: A short description of the metric. This may include short details of measurement methods.

relatesTo.description: The schema element that the metric relates. For example observation may be defined against items or against lot.

relatedItem.description: This field must be populated with the id of the item in this tender section which the metric relates to

observations.title: Observations
observations.description: An array of [Observation]: target or actual values for this metric.

Observation.title: Observation
Observation.description: An actual or target observation. Observations should include either a value (for financial metrics) or measure (for other metrics).

id.title: Identifier
id.description: A local identifier for this specific observation. This may be an arbitrary identifier, or could be a composite of the metric identifier, and the date and other dimensions of this observation.

period.title: Period
period.description: The [Period] over which this observation is measured.

value.title: Value
value.description: For financial metrics, the [Value] of this forecast, target or actual observation.

measure.title: Measure
measure.description: For non-financial metrics, the measure of this forecast, target or actual observation. Measures may be provided as free text or numerical values.

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The list from which units of measure identifiers are taken. This should be an entry in the unitClassificationScheme codelist. Use of the scheme 'UNCEFACT' for the UN/CEFACT Recommendation 20 list of 'Codes for Units of Measure Used in International Trade' is recommended.

id.title: ID
id.description: The identifier from the codelist referenced in the schema property. For example, with UNCEFACT, this is the value of the 'Common Code' column. From this identifier, applications can look-up the human readable name or symbol for this unit of measure.

uri.title: URI
uri.description: If the scheme used provide a machine-readable URI for this unit of measure, this can be given.

dimensions.title: Dimensions
dimensions.description: Any number of dimensions can be recorded within this object. Dimensions names should follow the camelCase conventions of OCDS.

notes.title: Notes
notes.description: Any notes on this observation. This may include clarifying information.

relatedImplementationMilestone.title: Related implementation milestone
relatedImplementationMilestone.description: A [MilestoneReference] to the milestone in the implementation section of OCDS to which this forecast, target or actual observation relates.

relatedRequirementID.title: Related requirement
relatedRequirementID.description: The [RequirementReference] of the requirement which the observation is applicable to

MilestoneReference.title: Milestone Reference
MilestoneReference.description: A block used to reference a milestone, including the ID and title of the milestone being referenced.

id.title: Milestone ID
id.description: The ID of the milestone being referenced, this must match the ID of a milestone described elsewhere in a release about this contracting process.

title.title: Milestone title
title.description: The title of the milestone being referenced, this must match the title of a milestone described elsewhere in a release about this contracting process.

FinancialProgressBreakdown.title: Financial progress breakdown
FinancialProgressBreakdown.description: This section allows a detailed breakdown of financial progress to be provided, each covering a particular periods, or allocating financial progress against particular funding sources and fiscal classifications.

id.title: Identifier
id.description: An identifier for this particular financial progress breakdown entry.

description.title: Description
description.description: A short free text description of this financial progress breakdown. This may be displayed in user interfaces to help users interpret this entry. This may be automatically generated from structured data or may be manually entered.

period.title: Budget period
period.description: The [Period] covered by this financial progress breakdown entry. This information may also be duplicated using classifications where relevant.

classifications.title: Budget classifications
classifications.description: Budget [Classification] must be provided as a set of key-value pairs, where the key is a dimension (or the label of a dimension) used in budget classification, and the value is the value of that dimension for this contracting process or specific contract (depending on the point within an OCDS file at which the classification is provided).

measures.title: measures
measures.description: Measures must be provided as a set of key-value pairs, where the key should be the name of the measure used within a related Fiscal Data Package dataset or other budget and spending dataset. The value is the value of this measure when last updated, and must be provided as a number in the same default currency as any aggregate reported budget or spending figures.

id.title: Identifier
id.description: An identifier for this particular budget entry.

description.title: Description
description.description: A short free text description of this budget entry.

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: The [Value] of the budget line item.

uri.title: Linked budget information
uri.description: A URI pointing directly to a machine-readable information about this budget entry.

period.title: Budget period
period.description: The [Period] covered by this budget entry.

sourceParty.title: Source party
sourceParty.description: The [OrganizationReference] for Organization or other party related to this budget entry. If the budget amount is positive, this indicates a flow of resources from the party to the contracting process. If the budget amount is negative, it indicates a payment from the contracting process to this party.

classifications.title: Budget classifications
classifications.description: Budget [Classification] must be provided as a set of key-value pairs, where the key is a dimension (or the label of a dimension) used in budget classification, and the value is the value of that dimension for this contracting process or specific contract (depending on the point within an OCDS file at which the classification is provided).

measures.title: measures
measures.description: Measures must be provided as a set of key-value pairs, where the key should be the name of the measure used within a related Fiscal Data Package dataset or other budget and spending dataset. The value is the value of this measure when last updated, and must be provided as a number in the same default currency as any aggregate reported budget or spending figures.

budgetBreakdownID.title: Budget Breakdown Identifier
budgetBreakdownID.description: An identifier for particular budget entry.

period.title: Budget period
period.description: The [Period] covered by this budget entry.

budgetBreakdownID.title: Budget Breakdown Identifier
budgetBreakdownID.description: An identifier for particular budget entry.

PerformanceFailure.title: Performance failure disclosure
PerformanceFailure.description: Details of the performance failures for a given period and category. Details of the associated penalties and abatements provided for in the contract, imposed and paid can also be provided.

id.title: Identifier
id.description: A local identifier for this specific category and period of performance failure. This field is used to keep track of revisions of a charge across multiple OCDS releases.

period.title: Performance failure [Period]
period.description: The reporting period for these performance failures.

category.title: Performance failure category
category.description: The category into which these performance failures fall.

events.title: Number of events
events.description: The number of performance failures for the given period and category.

penaltyContracted.title: Contracted penalty
penaltyContracted.description: A free text description of the penalty or abatement provided for in the contract for this period, category and number of performance failures.

penaltyImposed.title: Penalty imposed
penaltyImposed.description: A free text description of the penalty or abatement imposed for this period, category and number of performance failures.

penaltyPaid.title: Penalty paid
penaltyPaid.description: A yes/no field indicating whether the penalty imposed for this period, category and number of performance failures has been paid.

id.title: ID
id.description: A local identifier for this milestone, unique within this block. This field is used to keep track of multiple revisions of a milestone through the compilation from release to record mechanism.

type.title: Milestone type
type.description: The type of milestone, drawn from an extended [Codelists#Milestone types].

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of the milestone.

code.title: Milestone code
code.description: Milestone codes can be used to track specific events that take place for a particular kind of contracting process. For example, a code of 'approvalLetter' could be used to allow applications to understand this milestone represents the date an approvalLetter is due or signed. Milestone codes is an open codelist, and codes should be agreed amoungst data producers and the applications using that data.

dueDate.title: Due date
dueDate.description: The date the milestone is due.

dateMet.title: Date met
dateMet.description: The date on which the milestone was met.

dateModified.title: Date modified
dateModified.description: The date the milestone was last reviewed or modified and the status was altered or confirmed to still be correct.

status.title: Status
status.description: The status that was realized on the date provided in dateModified, drawn from the [Codelists#Milestone statuses].

relatedLots.title: Related lot(s)
relatedLots.description: If this milestone relates to a particular lot, provide the identifier(s) of the related lot(s) here.

relatedParties.title: Related Parties
relatedParties.description: Parties that have a relationship with the milestone as an array of [OrganizationReference]

Document.title: Document
Document.description: Links to, or descriptions of, external documents can be attached at various locations within the standard. Documents may be supporting information, formal notices, downloadable forms, or any other kind of resource that should be made public as part of full open contracting.

id.title: ID
id.description: A local, unique identifier for this document. This field is used to keep track of multiple revisions of a document through the compilation from release to record mechanism.

documentType.title: Document type
documentType.description: A classification of the document described taken from the [Codelists#Document types]. Values from the provided codelist should be used wherever possible, though extended values can be provided if the codelist does not have a relevant code.

description.title: Description
description.description: A short description of the document. We recommend descriptions do not exceed 250 words. In the event the document is not accessible online, the description field can be used to describe arrangements for obtaining a copy of the document.

url.title: URL
url.description: direct link to the document or attachment. The server providing access to this document should be configured to correctly report the document mime type.

datePublished.title: Date published
datePublished.description: The date on which the document was first published. This is particularly important for legally important documents such as notices of a tender.

dateModified.title: Date modified
dateModified.description: Date that the document was last modified

format.title: Format
format.description: The format of the document taken from the [IANA Media Types code list](http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/), with the addition of one extra value for 'offline/print', used when this document entry is being used to describe the offline publication of a document. Use values from the template column. Links to web pages should be tagged 'text/html'.

language.title: Language
language.description: Specifies the language of the linked document using either two-digit ISO 639-1 or extended BCP47 language tags.

relatedLots.title: Related lot(s)
relatedLots.description: If this document relates to a particular lot, provide the identifier(s) of the related lot(s) here.

pageStart.title: Page start
pageStart.description: When the information referenced exists within a large document, indicate the first page on which it can be found. This should refer to the printed page number, not the page number reported by software applications.

pageEnd.title: Page end
pageEnd.description: When the information referenced exists within a large document, indicate the last page on which it can be found. This should refer to the printed page number, not the page number reported by software applications.

accessDetails.title: Access details
accessDetails.description: A description of any special arrangements required to access this document. This may include a requirement to register for document access, a fee to be paid, or the location where documents can be inspected.

author.title: Author
author.description: The name of the author of these documents. Include the name of individuals and/or organizations responsible. For example, when a technical specification was written by a consultant, include the name and organization of the consultant.

Budget.title: Budget information
Budget.description: This section contain information about the budget line, and associated projects, through which this contracting process is funded. It draws upon data model of the [Fiscal Data Package](http://fiscal.dataprotocols.org/), and should be used to cross-reference to more detailed information held using a Budget Data Package, or, where no linked Budget Data Package is available, to provide enough information to allow a user to manually or automatically cross-reference with another published source of budget and project information.

description.description: Any free-text description from PE while aggregating budgets

amount.description: Automatically calculated amount of all aggregated budgets

budgetBreakdown.description: Automatically collected array of all budget breakdowns from all aggregated budgets

budgetAllocation.description: Where known, Procuring Entity can put an allocation of aggregated budget against needed items

id.title: ID
id.description: An identifier for the budget line item which provides funds for this contracting process. This identifier should be possible to cross-reference against the provided data source.

description.title: Budget Source
description.description: A short free text description of the budget source. May be used to provide the title of the budget line, or the programme used to fund this project.

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: The [Value] of the budget line item. A negative value indicates anticipated income to the budget as a result of this contracting process, rather than expenditure.

project.title: Project title
project.description: The name of the project that through which this contracting process is funded (if applicable). Some organizations maintain a registry of projects, and the data should use the name by which the project is known in that registry. No translation option is offered for this string, as translated values can be provided in third-party data, linked from the data source above.

projectID.title: Project identifier
projectID.description: An external identifier for the project that this contracting process forms part of, or is funded via (if applicable). Some organizations maintain a registry of projects, and the data should use the identifier from the relevant registry of projects.

uri.title: Linked budget information
uri.description: A URI pointing directly to a machine-readable record about the budget line-item or line-items that fund this contracting process. Information may be provided in a range of formats, including using IATI, the Open Fiscal Data Standard or any other standard which provides structured data on budget sources. Human readable documents can be included using the planning.documents block.

budgetBreakdown.title: Budget breakdown
budgetBreakdown.description: A array of [BudgetBreakdown] of the budget by period and/or participating funders.

budgetAllocation.title: Budget breakdown
budgetAllocation.description: An array of [BudgetAllocation] of the budget

Transaction.title: Transaction information
Transaction.description: A spending transaction related to the contracting process. Draws upon the data models of the Fiscal Data Package (http://fiscal.dataprotocols.org/) and the International Aid Transpareny Initiative (http://iatistandard.org/activity-standard/iati-activities/iati-activity/transaction/) and should be used to cross-reference to more detailed information held using a Fiscal Data Package, IATI file, or to provide enough information to allow a user to manually or automatically cross-reference with some other published source of transactional spending data.

id.title: ID
id.description: A unique identifier for this transaction. This identifier should be possible to cross-reference against the provided data source. For IATI this is the transaction reference.

source.title: Data source
source.description: Used to point either to a corresponding Fiscal Data Package, IATI file, or machine or human-readable source where users can find further information on the budget line item identifiers, or project identifiers, provided here.

payer.title: Payer
payer.description: An [OrganizationReference] for the organization from which the funds in this transaction originate.

payee.title: Payee
payee.description: An [OrganizationReference] for the organization which receives the funds in this transaction.

uri.title: Linked spending information
uri.description: A URI pointing directly to a machine-readable record about this spending transaction.

name.description: The name of the party being referenced. This must match the name of an entry in the parties section.
name.title: Organization name

id.description: The id of the party being referenced. This must match the id of an entry in the parties section.
id.title: Organization ID

OrganizationReference.description: The id and name of the party being referenced. Used to cross-reference to the parties section
OrganizationReference.title: Organization reference

scale.title: Scale
scale.description: For commercial organization's additional classification information about parties can be provided using [Codelists#Party scale codes]

classifications.decription: Any additional classifications for both buyers and sellerd, described as ab array of [Classification]

typeOfBuyer.title: Type of Buyer
typeOfBuyer.description: A value from the [Codelists#Types of Buyer] codelist]. The type of buyer taken from the EU's specified list in its TED forms.

typeOfSupplier.descriptiopn: Specifing whether this Entity is 'personel' or 'company' as [Classification]

mainGeneralActivity.title: Main General Activity
mainGeneralActivity.description: A value from the [Codelists#Main General Activities] codelist. The main general activity of the buyer taken from the EU's specified list in its TED forms which is taken from the United Nations Classification of the Functions of Government (COFOG) codelist.

mainSectoralActivity.title: Main Sectoral Activity
mainSectoralActivity.description: A value from the [Codelists#Main Sectoral Activities] codelist. The main sectoral activity of the buyer taken from the EU's specified list in its TED forms which is taken from the United Nations Classification of the Functions of Government (COFOG) codelist.

isACentralPurchasingBody.title: Is the organization a central purchasing body?
isACentralPurchasingBody.description: A true/false field to indicate whether the organization is a central purchasing body.

bankAccounts.description: Banking detalis of the entity as an array of [BankAccount]

mainEconomicActivities.description: A list of [Classification] of the registered activities of organization

legalForm.description: Information about [Classificarion] of the legal form of the organization

permits.description: Information about set of [Permit] and licenses issued for the organization

name.title: Common name
name.description: A common name for this organization or participant in the contracting process. The identifier object provides an space for the formal legal name, and so this may either repeat that value, or could provide the common name by which this organization is known. This field could also include details of the department or sub-unit involved in this contracting process.

id.description: The ID used for cross-referencing to this party from other sections of the release. This field may be built with the following structure {identifier.scheme}-{identifier.id}(-{department-identifier}).
id.title: Entity ID

identifier.title: Primary identifier
identifier.description: The primary [Identifier] for this organization. Identifiers that uniquely pick out a legal entity should be preferred. Consult the [organization identifier guidance](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/identifiers/) for the preferred scheme and identifier to use.

additionalIdentifiers.title: Additional identifiers
additionalIdentifiers.description: Any additional / supplemental [Identifier] for the organization. This could be used to provide an internally used identifier for this organization in addition to the primary legal entity identifier.

address.desciption: This may be the legally registered [Address] of the organization, or may be a correspondence address for this particular contracting process

contactPoint.description: [Contact point] details that can be used for this party

additionalContactPoints.description: Additional [Contact point] (or many of them) details that can be used for this party

persones.description: List of persones associated with this organization described with [Persone] array

roles.title: Entity roles
roles.description: The party's role(s) in the contracting process. Role(s) should be taken from the [Codelists#Party RoleS]. Values from the provided codelist should be used wherever possible, though extended values can be provided if the codelist does not have a relevant code.

buyerProfile.title: Buyer Profile URI
buyerProfile.description: For buyer organisations only: the url of the organization's buyer profile. Specified by the EU

subOrganizations.description: List of [OrganizationReference] for the sub-organizations of devisions of this organization

memberOf.description: List of [OrganizationReference] for the organizations that include this organization

parentOrganizations.description: List of [OrganizationReference] for the parents of this organization

scheme.description: Identifier that uniquely pick out a legal registry consists needed details

id.description: Identifier of permit/license in selected scheme

description.description: The human readable name of permit/license in selected scheme

uri.description: A URI to identify the permit/license

issuedBy.description: [OrganizationReference] on Entity who issued this permit/license

validityPeriod.description: [Period] of validity of this permit/license. It could be any attributes of 'Period'

issuedThought.description: [EconomicActivityReference] to a activity (described in 'mainEconomicActivities') which is covered by this permit/license

additionalAccountIndentifiers.description: Account additional requisites as an array of [Classification]

email.description: The e-mail address of the contact point/person.

telephone.description: The telephone number of the contact point/person. This should include the international dialling code.

url.description: A web address for the contact point/person.

identifier.description: The legal [Identifier] of this person according to local identification scheme

type.description: Business function type accodring to the [Codelists#Business function types]

jobTitle.description: [Classification] and human-readeble description of persones' position

Unit.title: Unit
Unit.description: A description of the unit in which the supplies, services or works are provided (e.g. hours, kilograms) and the unit-price. For comparability, an established list of units can be used.

value.title: Value
value.description: The monetary [Value] of a single unit.

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The list from which units of measure identifiers are taken. Use of the scheme 'UNCEFACT' for the UN/CEFACT Recommendation 20 list of 'Codes for Units of Measure Used in International Trade' is recommended.

id.title: ID
id.description: The identifier from the codelist referenced in the scheme property. For example, with UNCEFACT, this is the value of the 'Common Code' column. From this identifier, applications can look-up the human readable name or symbol for this unit of measure.

uri.title: URI
uri.description: If the scheme used provide a machine-readable URI for this unit of measure, this can be given.

Item.title: Item
Item.description: A good, service, or work to be contracted.

id.title: ID
id.description: A local identifier to reference and merge the items by. Must be unique within a given array of items.

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of the goods, services to be provided.

classification.title: Classification
classification.description: The primary [Classification] for the item. See the

additionalClassifications.title: Additional classifications
additionalClassifications.description: An array of additional [Classification] for the item. This may also be used to present codes from an internal classification scheme.

unit.title: Unit
unit.description: A description of the [Unit] in which the supplies, services or works are provided

relatedLots.title: Related lot(s)
relatedLots.description: If this item belongs to a lot, provide the identifier(s) of the related lot(s) here.

deliveryLocation.title: Delivery Location
deliveryLocation.description: The [Location] where activity related to this tender, contract or license will be delivered, or will take place.

deliveryAddress.title: Delivery Address
deliveryAddress.description: The [Address] to which, or where, goods or services related to this tender, contract or license will be delivered.

Geometry.title: Geometry
Geometry.description: We follow the http://geojson.org/ to express basic location information, using longitude, latitude, and (optionally) elevation values in the WGS84 (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Geodetic_System) (EPSG:4326) projection. A point location can be identified by geocoding a delivery address. For concession licenses, or other contracts covering a polygon location which is not contained in a known gazetteer, polygon and multi-polygon can be used.

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of GeoJSON Geometry Objects (http://geojson.org/geojson-spec.html#geometry-objects) being provided. To provide longitude, latitude, and (optionally) elevation, use 'Point', and enter an array of longitude, latitude or longitude, latitude, elevation as the value of the coordinates field. Note the capitalization of type values, in order to maintain compatibility with GeoJSON.

coordinates.title: Coordinates
coordinates.description: The relevant array of points, e.g. [longitude, latitude] or [longitude, latitude, elevation], or a nested array of points, for the GeoJSON geometry being described. The longitude and latitude MUST be expressed in decimal degrees in the WGS84 (EPSG:4326) projection.

Gazetter.title: Gazetteer
Gazetter.description: A gazetteer is a geographical index or directory. The specific gazetteer used should be specified in scheme, and one or more codes from that gazetteer used in identifier.

scheme.title: Gazetteer scheme
scheme.description: The entry of the selected gazetteer in the gazetteers codelist. The codelist provides details of services, where available, that can resolve a gazetteer entry to provide location names.

identifiers.title: Identifiers
identifiers.description: An array of one or more codes drawn from the gazetteer indicated in scheme.

Location.title: Delivery Location
Location.description: The location where activity related to this tender, contract or license will be delivered, or will take place. A location can be described by either a geometry (point location, line or polygon), or a gazetteer entry, or both.

description.title: Description
description.description: A name or description of this location. This might include the name(s) of the location(s), or might provide a human readable description of the location to be covered. This description may be used in a user-interface.

uri.title: URI
uri.description: A URI to a further description of the activity location. This may be a human readable document with information on the location, or a machine-readable description of the location.

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: An classification should be drawn from an existing scheme or list of codes. This field is used to indicate the scheme/codelist from which the classification is drawn.

id.title: ID
id.description: The classification code drawn from the selected scheme.

description.title: Description
description.description: A textual description or title for the code.

uri.title: URI
uri.description: A URI to identify the code. In the event individual URIs are not available for items in the identifier scheme this value should be left blank.

ExchangeRate.title: Exchange Rate
ExchangeRate.description: The exchange rate used, or to be used, to convert amount into an alternative currency.

rate.title: Currency conversion rate
rate.description: The rate to use in converting amount to the alternative currency. Amount x Rate = Alternative Currency Amount.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: The destination currency for conversion of amount. Currency should always be specified using the uppercase 3-letter currency code from ISO4217.

date.title: Exchange rate date
date.description: The date at which this exchange rate was current.

source.title: Exchange rate source
source.description: The source used to provide the value of the exchange rate, taken from the exchangeRateSource codelist.

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: Organization identifiers be drawn from an existing identification scheme. This field is used to indicate the scheme or codelist in which the identifier will be found. This value should be drawn from the Organization Identification

id.title: ID
id.description: The identifier of the organization in the selected scheme.

legalName.title: Legal Name
legalName.description: The legally registered name of the organization.

uri.title: URI
uri.description: A URI to identify the organization, such as those provided by Open Corporates (http://www.opencorporates.com) or some other relevant URI provider. This is not for listing the website of the organization: that can be done through the url field of the Organization contact point.

Address.title: Address
Address.description: An address. This may be the legally registered address of the organization, or may be a correspondence address for this particular contracting process.

streetAddress.title: Street address
streetAddress.description: The street address. For example, 1600 Amphitheatre Pkwy.

locality.title: Locality
locality.description: The locality. For example, Mountain View.

countryName.title: Country name
countryName.description: The country name. For example, United States.

localityDetails.description: Locality code [Classification] according to either 'UN/LOCDE' or any applicable local classifier

NUTSCode.title: NUTS Code
NUTSCode.description: The most detailed level of NUTS codes, NUTS 3 should be used and it should be taken from the EU codelist linked from http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/ramon/index.cfm?TargetUrl=DSP_PUB_WELC.

ContactPoint.title: Contact point
ContactPoint.description: A person, contact point or department to contact in relation to this contracting process.

id.description: The legal identifier of this person according to local identification scheme used as a cross-reference to the full description ob the person, including contacts and business function, described in the 'persones' section

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the contact person, department, or contact point, for correspondence relating to this contracting process.

email.title: Email
email.description: The e-mail address of the contact point/person.

telephone.title: Telephone
telephone.description: The telephone number of the contact point/person. This should include the international dialling code.

url.title: URL
url.description: A web address for the contact point/person.

availableLanguage.title: URL
availableLanguage.description: A web address for the contact point/person.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: The currency for each amount should always be specified using the uppercase 3-letter currency code from ISO4217.

exchangeRates.title: Exchange rates
exchangeRates.description: Used to specify any [ExchangeRate] used, or to be used, to convert from amount to an alternative currency. To include alternative currency values within the data itself, add an 'amount_CODE' property alongside amount (e.g. amount_USD). See the extension documentation for more details.

valueAddedTaxIncluded.title: A true/false field to indicate whether the value tax was included

startDate.title: Start date
startDate.description: The start date for the period.

endDate.title: End date
endDate.description: The end date for the period.

maxExtentDate.description: The period cannot be extended beyond this date.
maxExtentDate.title: Maximum extent

durationInDays.description: The maximum duration of this period in days. Where a start and end date are given, this field is optional, and should reflect the difference between those two days.
durationInDays.title: Duration (days)

RelatedProcess.description: A link to a related contracting process in OCDS and the type of relationship.
RelatedProcess.title: Related Process

uri.description: A URI pointing to an OCDS release or record for the related process. This should be a machine-readable release or record package containing the relevant ocid.
uri.title: Related process URI

id.description: A local identifier for this relationship, unique within this array.

relationship.description: Specify the type of relationship using the [Codelists#Related processes relationships] codelist
relationship.title: Relationship

title.description: The title of the related process, where possible this field should match the tender/title field in the related process.
title.title: Related process title

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The identification scheme used by this cross-reference from the related process scheme codelist codelist. When cross-referencing information also published using OCDS, an Open Contracting ID (ocid) should be used.

BidsStatistic.title: Bid Statistic
BidsStatistic.description: For reporting aggregate statistics about the bids related to a tender. Where lots are in use, statistics may optionally be broken down by lot.

id.title: ID
id.description: An internal identifier for this statistical item.

measure.title: Measure
measure.description: An item from the bidStatistics codelist for the statisic reported in value.

date.title: Date
date.description: The date when this statistic was last updated. This is often the closing date of the tender process. This field can be left blank unless either (a) the same statistic is provided from multiple points in time, or (b) there is a specific local requirement for the data when statistics were calculated to be provided.

value.title: Value
value.description: The value for the measure in question. Total counts should be provided as an integer. Percentages should be presented as a proportion of 1 (e.g. 10% = 0.1)

notes.title: Notes
notes.description: Any notes required to understand or interpret the given statistic.

relatedLot.title: Related Lot
relatedLot.description: Where lots are in use, if this statistic relates to bids on a particular lot, provide the lot identifier here. If left blank, the statistic will be interpreted as applying to the whole tender.

Bid.title: Bid
Bid.description: For representing a bid in response to the tender or qualification stage in this contracting process.

id.title: ID
id.description: A local identifier for this bid

date.title: Date
date.description: The date when this bid was received.

status.title: Status
status.description: The status of the bid, drawn from the bidStatus codelist

tenderers.title: Tenderer
tenderers.description: The [OrganizationReference] for party, or parties, responsible for this bid. This should provide a name and identifier, cross-referenced to an entry in the parties array at the top level of the release.

documents.title: Documents
documents.description: Any [Document] and attachment related to the bid and its evaluation.

relatedLots.title: Related lot(s)
relatedLots.description: If this bid relates to one or more specific lots, provide the identifier(s) of the related lot(s) here.
relatedLots.NOTE: Compare againt lotValues approach in open procument API - http://api-docs.openprocurement.org/en/latest/lots.html

requirementResponses.TODO: ADD REQUIREMENT RESPONSE SECTION TO REQUIREMENTS EXTENSION
requirementResponses.description: A set of [RequirementResponse] relevant to the requirements requested under Contract Notice

Lot.title: Lots
Lot.description: A lot is a grouping of items within a tender that can be bid on or awarded together.

id.title: Lot ID
id.description: A local identifier for this lot, such as a lot number. This is used in relatedLot references at the item, document and award level.

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of this lot.

status.title: Lot Status
status.description: The current status of the process related to this lot based on the [Codelists#Tender statuses

value.title: Lot value
value.description: The maximum estimated [Value] of this lot.

options.title: Lot options
options.description: Details about any [Option] related to this lot: if they will be accepted and what they can consist of. Required by the EU

recurrence.title: Recurrence
recurrence.description: Information on the [Recurrence] of the lot.

variants.title: Lot variants
variants.description: Details about lot [Variants]: if they will be accepted and what they can consist of. Required by the EU

placeOfPerformance.title: Place of Performance
placeOfPerformance.description: The address, NUTS code and further description of the place where the contract will be performed - [PlaceOfPerformance]

classification.title: Place of Performance
classification.description: The address, NUTS code and further description of the place where the contract will be performed - [PlaceOfPerformance]

LotDetails.title: Lot Details
LotDetails.description: If this tender is divided into lots, details can be provided here of any criteria that apply to bidding on these lots. This extended property is currently focussed on fields required by the EU TED data standard

maximumLotsBidPerSupplier.title: Maximum lots per supplier
maximumLotsBidPerSupplier.description: The maximum number of lots that one supplier may bid for as part of this contracting process.

maximumLotsAwardedPerSupplier.title: Maximum lots per supplier
maximumLotsAwardedPerSupplier.description: The maximum number of lots that may be awarded to one supplier as part of this contracting process.

LotGroup.title: Lot group
LotGroup.description: Where the buyer reserves the right to combine lots, or wishes to specify the total value for a group of lots, a lot group is used to capture this information.

id.title: Lot group identifier
id.description: A local identifier for this group of lots.

relatedLots.title: Related lot(s)
relatedLots.description: A list of the identifiers of the lots that form this group. Lots may appear in more than one group.

optionToCombine.title: Option to combine
optionToCombine.description: The buyer reserves the right to combine the lots in this group when awarding a contract.

maximumValue.title: Maximum value
maximumValue.description: The maximum estimated [Value] of the lots in this group. This may be lower than the sum total of lot values

type.title: Fee type
type.description: A fees applicable to bidders wishing to participate in the tender process. Fees may apply for access to bidding documents, for the submission of bids or there may be a win fee payable by the successful bidder.

description.title: Description
description.description: Optional information about the way in which fees are levied, or the exact nature of the fees.

methodOfPayment.title: Method(s) of payment
methodOfPayment.description: Optional information about the way in which fees can be paid.

Criterion.title: Criterion
Criterion.description: A criterion on which either bidders or items will be judged, evaluated or assessed.

id.description: The identifier for this criterion. It must be unique and cannot change within the Open Contracting Process it is part of (defined by a single ocid).

description.description: Criterion description

source.description: Source of response to the requirements specificed in the criterion, for example responses may be submitted by tenderers or by an assessment committee at the procuringEntity.

relatesTo.description: The schema element that the criterion judges, evaluates or assesses. For example criterion may be defined against items or against bidders.

relatedItem.description: Where relatesTo = "item" this field must be populated with the id of the item in this tender section which the criterion relates to. Where relatesTo <> "item" this field should be omitted

requirementGroups.title: Requirement groups
requirementGroups.description: A list of [RequirementGroup] for this Criterion. A criterion is satisfied by one or more requirement groups being met. A requirement group is met when all requirements in the group are satisfied.

RequirementGroup.title: Requirement group
RequirementGroup.description: A requirement group is a set of requirements that must be fulfilled together to validate a criterion.

id.description: The identifier for this requirement group. It must be unique and cannot change within the Open Contracting Process it is part of (defined by a single ocid).

description.description: Requirement group description

requirements.title: Requirements
requirements.description: A list of any [Requirement] which must all be satisified for the requirement group to be met.

Requirement.title: Requirement
Requirement.description: An atomic requirement. Requirements can specify the expected value that the response has to contain, or a range of threshold values within which the response has to fit in. The requirement may apply to a certain period of time

id.description: The identifier for this requirement. It must be unique and cannot change within the Open Contracting Process it is part of (defined by a single ocid).

description.description: Requirement description

pattern.description: A regular expression against which validate the requirement response

expectedValue.description: Used to state the requirement when the response must be particular value

minValue.description: Used to state the lower bound of the requirement when the response must be within a certain range

maxValue.description: Used to state the upper bound of the requirement when the response must be within a certain range

period.description: Used to specify a particular [Period] the requirement applies to, for example the bidder's turnover in a given year

eligibleEvidences.title: Eligible evidences
eligibleEvidences.description: Any [Evidance] that will be accepted as a proof of sasisfaction of sepcific requirement

Recurrence.title: Recurrence
Recurrence.description: Information on the recurrence of the contracting process.

dates.title: Estimated dates
dates.description: An estimate of the [Period] of subsequent initiations of contracting processes (e.g. notices of intended procurement).

description.title: Further information
description.description: Any further information on the recurrence of the contracting process.

RequirementResponse.title: Requirement Response
RequirementResponse.description: An assertion that responds to a single requirement. A requirement response provides the value for the requirement and may provide the period to which it applies.

id.description: The identifier for this requirement response. It must be unique and cannot change within the Open Contracting Process it is part of (defined by a single ocid).

description.description: Requirement response description

value.description: Requirement response value. The value must be of the type defined in the requirement.dataType field

period.description: The [Period] which the requirement response is applicable to

requirement.title: Related requirement
requirement.description: The [RequirementReference] of the requirement which the response is applicable to

relatedTenderer.title: Related tenderer
relatedTenderer.description: Where this requirement response relates to a tenderer and is provided by the buyer or procuring entity this field should be used as [OrganizationReference] the entry in the parties section for the tenderer the response relates to.

relatedItem.title: Related Item
relatedItem.description: Where this requirement response relates to an item and is provided by the buyer or procuring entity this field should be used to reference the id in the items' section for the item the response relates to.

RequirementReference.title: Requirement reference
RequirementReference.description: Used to cross reference a requirement

id.title: Requirement ID
id.description: The id of the requirement which the response is applicable to

title.title: Requirement title
title.description: The title of the requirement which the response is applicable to

ValueBreakdown.title: Value Breakdown
ValueBreakdown.description: The breakdown of known and/or estimated values in this contract.

id.title: id
id.description: The identifier of this value breakdown. Unique within this array.

type.title: type
type.description: A value from the valueType codelist that identifies the nature of the value in the breakdown. Negative values indicate a revenue to the supplier.

description.title: description
description.description: The description of this value breakdown.

amount.title: amount
amount.description: The amount of this [Value] breakdown. A positive value represents a transaction from buyer to supplier. A negative value represents a payment from the supplier to the buyer.

estimationMethod.title: Estimation Method
estimationMethod.description: The estimation method of this [Value] breakdown, where applicable.

hasOptions.title: Lot Options
hasOptions.description: A True/False field to indicate if lot options will be accepted. Required by the EU

optionDetails.title: Lot option details
optionDetails.description: Further information about the lot options that will be accepted. Required by the EU

hasRenewals.title: Has renewals?
hasRenewals.description: A True/False field to indicate whether contract renewals are allowed.

maxNumber.title: Maximum number
maxNumber.description: Maximum number of renewals of this lot

renewalConditions.title: Renewal Conditions
renewalConditions.description: Conditions for, and descriptions of, any renewals of this lot

hasVariants.title: Lot Variants
hasVariants.description: A True/False field to indicate if lot variants will be accepted. Required by the EU

variantDetails.title: Lot variant details
variantDetails.description: Further information about the lot variants that will be accepted. Required by the EU

isAcceleratedProcedure.title: is Accelerated Procedure?
isAcceleratedProcedure.description: A True/False field to indicate whether an accelerated procedure has been used for this procurement

acceleratedProcedureJustification.title: Accelerated Procedure Justification
acceleratedProcedureJustification.description: Justification for using an accelerated procedure

useOrdering.title: Tender uses electronic ordering
useOrdering.description: A True/False field to indicate if electronic ordering will be used. Required by the EU

usePayment.title: Tender uses electronic payment
usePayment.description: A True/False field to indicate if electronic payment will be used. Required by the EU

acceptInvoicing.title: Tender accepts electronic invoicing
acceptInvoicing.description: A True/False field to indicate if electronic invoicing will be accepted. Required by the EU

isJointProcurement.title: Is A Joint Procurement
isJointProcurement.description: A True/False field to indicate if this is a joint procurement or not. Required by the EU

country.title: Country
country.description: ISO Country Code of the country where the law applies. Use ISO Alpha-2 country codes.

types.title: Types of tender objectives
types.description: Contract performance conditions with environmental, social and innovative objectives. Required by the EU.

additionalInformation.title: Tender objectives additional information
additionalInformation.description: Further details about the objectives of the procurement. Required by the EU

procedureOutsourced.title: procedureOutsourced
procedureOutsourced.description: A True/False field to indicate whether the procurement procedure has been outsourced

outsourcedTo.title: Outsourced To
outsourcedTo.description: An [OrganizationReference] to identify the organization that is running the outsourced procedure

PlaceOfPerformance.title: Place of Performance
PlaceOfPerformance.description: The address, NUTS code and further description of the place where the contract will be performed

address.title: address
address.description: [Address] for the place of performance of the contract.

description.title: description
description.description: Further description of the place of performance of the contract. Required by EU.

AuctionsStatistic.description: For reporting aggregate statistics about the auctions related to a tender. Where lots are in use, statistics may optionally be broken down by lot.

id.description: An internal identifier for this statistical item.

measure.description: An item from the auctionsStatistics codelist for the statisic reported in value.

date.description: The date when this statistic was last updated. This is often the closing date of the auction process.

value.description: The value for the measure in question. Total counts should be provided as an integer. Percentages should be presented as a proportion of 1 (e.g. 10% = 0.1)

notes.description: Any notes required to understand or interpret the given statistic.

relatedAuction.description: If this statistic relates to auction on a particular lot, provide the lot identifier here. If left blank, the statistic will be interpreted as applying to the whole contracting process phase

Action.title: Action
Action.description: The sepcific actions that has to be taken

action.title: Action tag
action.description: The code of exepcted value according to codelist

auctionGroupID.title: Auction group identifier
auctionGroupID.description: The unique identifier of the group of rounds under this electronic auction on which this action is relates (where action:gotoGroup)

ActionTriggers.description: The prescribed set of actions that has to be taken depending on whether targets of this stage of the electroic auction achieved or not or stage was cancelled due to conditions of start

targetsAchieved.title: Targets achieved
targetsAchieved.description: The [Action] prescribed for the case if targets of this stage of the electronic auction where acheived

targetsNotAchieved.title: Targets not achieved
targetsNotAchieved.description: The [Action] prescribed for the case if targets of this stage of the electronic auction where not acheived

groupCancelled.title: Group cancelled
groupCancelled.description: The [Action] prescribed for the case if this stage of the electronic auction was cancelled do to requirements of the conditions to start

Auction.title: Electronic auction
Auction.description: Data regarding electronic auction established against specific lot

id.title: Identifier
id.description: Unique identifier fot this electronic auction

relatedLot.title: Related lot id
relatedLot.description: Unique identifier of the lot under this contracting process agaist which this electronis acution is established

url.title: URL
url.description: The url for this electronic auction

auctionPeriod.title: Auction period
auctionPeriod.description: The [Period] of time allocated (spent) for execution of this electronic auction

criteria.title: Auction criteria
criteria.description: Any [Criterion] on which this stage of the electronic auction will be launched, judged, evaluated or assessed.

auctionBreakdown.title: Auction breakdown
auctionBreakdown.description: The stages of this electronic auction, described as [AuctionRoundsGroup]

auctionResult.title: Auction results
auctionResult.descirption: Data regarding outcomes of this electronic auction

status.title: status
status.description: The result status of this electconic auction based on the auction critera

bids.title: Bids
bids.description: The set of bids resulting this stage of the electronic auction

AuctionRoundsGroup.title: Auction rounds group
AuctionRoundsGroup.description: The number of rounds searated as a block containing this electronic auction

id.title: Identifier
id.desciption: Unique ID for this stage of the electronic auction

title.title: Title
title.desciption: The title of this stage of the electronic auction

description.title: Description
description.desciption: The description of this stage of the electronic auction

relatedModalities.title: Related modalities
relatedModalities.desciption: The id of the preset of electronic auction modalities applied for this stage of the electronic auction

targets.title: Targets
targets.desciption: The set of targets prescribed for this stage of the electronic auction that has to be achieved to consider this stage as successfull. As an array of [Metric]

actions.title: Stage actions
actions.description: The [ActionTriggers] for this stage of the electronic auction

invitedTenderers.title: Invited particiants
invitedTenderers.description: The set of the groups of the invited particiapnts described using as [InvitationToAuction]

rounds.title: Rounds
rounds.desciption: The set of [AuctionRound] arranged under this stage of the electronic auction

AuctionRound.title: Round
AuctionRound.desciption: The athomic element of the electronic auctions' structure

id.title: Identifier
id.desciption: The unique identifier for this round

roundPeriod.title: Round period
roundPeriod.description: The [Period] (either start/end dates or duration) for this round

auctionGroupID.title: Auction group identifier
auctionGroupID.description: The unique identifier of the group of rounds under this electronic auction on which actionThreshold is relates (where auctionThreshold:groupWinningOffer)

eligibleMinDifference.description: Min eligible difference for this round described as [ValueDifference]]

eligibleExpectedDifference.description: Exepcted difference for this round described as [ValueDifference]

eligibleMaxDifference.description: Max eligible difference for this round described as [ValueDifference]

bids.description: Set of all [Bid] result this round

ElectronicAuctionModalities.title: Electronic Aucton Modalities preset
ElectronicAuctionModalities.description: The strict preset of settings and adjustments available for the electronic auction as one one of the procurement methods modalities applied under this contracting process

id.title: Identifier
id.description: Unique identifier for this Electronic Aucton Modalities preset

description.title: Description
description.description: Free-text exlanatory description for this Electronic Aucton Modalities preset

modalities.title: Modalities
modalities.description: A set of modalities, providing detailed information on the specific auction

auctionMethod.title: Electroic auction method
auctionMethod.description: Electroic auction method applied for this stage of the electronic auction

auctionMethodDetails.title: Electroic auction view mode
auctionMethodDetails.description: Electroic auction view mode applied for this stage of the electronic auction

auctionSubmissionOrder.title: Order of submission
auctionSubmissionOrder.description: Primary and secondary orders of tenderes submissions prescribed for this stage of the electronic auction

auctionDirection.title: Electronic auction direction
auctionDirection.description: The direction of the available change of initial offers during this stage of the electronic auction

auctionAwardCriteria.title: Electronic auction award criteria
auctionAwardCriteria.description: Primary and secondary criteria of the evaluation of offers received within this stage of the electronic auction

disclosureCategory.title: Disclosure rules
disclosureCategory.description: Disclosure rules for the offers received within this stage of the electronic auction

checkpoint.title: Targets checkpoint
checkpoint.description: The event when the achievement of the targets has to be checked for this stage of the electronic auction

Evidence.title: Evidance
Evidence.description: The data set describing some evidence

id.title: Identifier
id.description: Unique identifier for this evidence

attribute.title: Attribute
attribute.descrpption: The attribute of the object indicated with criterion.source for wich the value an exepcted will be considered as an evidence

value.title: Value
value.description: Value which is expected as an evidence

relatesTo.title: Relates to
relatesTo.description: Where several evidences are expected to satisfy this evidence, the related tye of the source has to be specified here

relatedItem.title: Related Item ID
relatedItem.description: Where 'relatesTo' is used, the precise unique id of the source has to be specified here

InvitationToAuction.title: Invitation
InvitationToAuction.description: The set data describing the category of the participants of this electronic auction to be invited to specific stage of such auction

category.title: Particiapnts catogory
category.description: The category of the participants who otentially can be invited. Described usin codelist

auctionGroupID.title: Auction group identifier
auctionGroupID.description: The unique identifier of the group of rounds under this electronic auction on which this action is relates (where action:gotoGroup)

Conversion.title: Conversion
Conversion.description: Conversion is used to describe conversions and its coefficients applicable for specific value received for requirement or observation

id.title: Identifier
id.description: An identifier for this conversion.

relatesTo.title: Related schema element
relatesTo.description: The schema element that the conversion applies. For example, the conversion may be defined against a requirement or against a metric.

relatedItem.title: Related item
relatedItem.description: Where 'relatesTo' is not empty this field must be populated with the id of the item in this tender section which the conversion relates to.

rationale.title: Conversion rationale
rationale.description: The free-text rationale of using of this conversion

description.title: Conversion Details
description.description: Free texrt description of this conversion could be shared here

coefficients.title: Coefficients
coefficients.description: A list of any applicable [Coefficient] for this conversion

Coefficient.title: Coefficient
Coefficient.description: A coefficient applied in case of the value of prescribed attribute matches

id.title: Identifier
id.description: An identifier for this coefficient.

value.title: Requirement value
value.description: Value of related 'requirement' or one of available 'options' if applicable received through 'requirementResponse'

minValue.title: Inducative minimum requirement value
minValue.description: Indicative minimum value of related 'requirement' or one of available 'options' if applicable received through 'requirementResponse'

maxValue.title: Indicative maximum value
maxValue.description: Indicative maximum value of related 'requirement' or one of available 'options' if applicable received through 'requirementResponse'

period.title: Period
period.description: Used to specify a particular [Period] the conversion and its coefficients are applies to

coefficient.title: Coefficient
coefficient.description: Precise value that has to be applied for conversion in specific case

formula.title: Formula
formula.description: Where mathematical formula is used to calculate precise value that has to be applied for conversion in specific case this field must be populated with such formula

Complaint.title: Complaint
Complaint.description: A complaint submitted against conditions or decision made

id.title: Identifier
id.description: Unique identifier for this complaint

date.title: Submission date
date.description: Date of submission of this complaint

status.title: Status
status.description: The current status of the complaint

relatesTo.title: Relates to
relatesTo.description: The schema element that the complaint affects. For example complaint may be defined against lot or against prequalification

relatedItem.title: Related item
relatedItem.description: The id of the schema element which the objection affects on.

statusDetails.title: Status details
statusDetails.description: The details of current status of the complaint

description.title: Description
description.description: Free-text description for this complaint provided by complainer

complainer.title: Complainer
complainer.description: An [OrganizationReference] for the Legal entity who have submitted this complaint

milestones.title: Milestones
milestones.description: A list of each [Milestone] associated with the complaint

documents.title: Documents
documents.description: Each [Document] and attachments related to the complaint

objections.title: Objections
objections.description: A list of precise subjects and requests under this complaint as an array of [Objection]

previousProceeding.title: Previous proceeding
previousProceeding.description: If this complaint is escalated from previous one sent to and rejected or declined by Procuring Entity, the id of such complaint could be specified to fulfill the requirements dual-stage review system

Review.title: Review procedure
Review.description: Review Procedure conducted agains one or more complaints

id.title: Identifier
id.description: Unique identifier for this procedure

date.title: Initiation date
date.description: Date of initiation of this procedure

status.title: Status
status.description: The current status of the procedure

statusDetails.title: Status details
statusDetails.description: The details of current status of the procedure

relatedComplaints.title: Related complaints
relatedComplaints.description: A list of the id's of complaints covered by this procedure

documents.title: Documents
documents.description: Each [Document] and attachment related to the procedure

objectionResponses.title: Objection responses
objectionResponses.description: A list of [ObjectionResponse] against all actions requested under relatede complaints

Objection.title: Objection
Objection.description: A precise subject and requests expected to be responded

id.title: Identifier
id.description: Unique identifier for this objection

description.title: Description
description.description: Bojections' brief description provided by complainer

status.title: Status
status.description: The current status of the objection

statusDetails.title: Status details
statusDetails.description: The details of current status of the objection

relatesTo.title: Relates to
relatesTo.description: The schema element that the objection affects. For example objection may be defined against lot or against award

relatedItem.title: Related item
relatedItem.description: The id of the schema element which the objection affects on.

classification.title: Classification
classification.description: [Classification] according to Review Bodies' approach to systemize subjects of complaint

requestedActions.title: Requested actions
requestedActions.description: A list of precise [RequestedAction] under this objection

RequestedAction.title: Requested action
RequestedAction.description: A precise action requested to satisfy an objection under complaint

id.title: Identifier
id.description: Unique identifier for this requested action

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of the requested action

source.title: Source
source.description: The party that will be obliged to take the requested action if the objection is satisfied

description.title: Description
description.description: Free text description of the requested action provided by complainer

id.title: Identifier
id.description: Unique identifier for this response on objection

requestedAction.title: Requested action
requestedAction.description: An id of the requested action against whitch this response is published

justification.title: Justification
justification.description: Free text justification for response provided by adressed Party

RelatedComplaint.title: Related Complaint
RelatedComplaint.description: The id of the related complaint

Planning.description: Information from the planning phase of the contracting process. Note that many other fields may be filled in a planning release, in the appropriate fields in other schema sections, these would likely be estimates at this stage e.g. totalValue in tender

forecasts.description: The general quantitive forecast of the scope of needs. Where quantities are specified within PNs aggregated, such forecast can be extracted and calculated automatically. Otherwise, PE has to specify it

rationale.description: The general free-text justification for the plan of this initiation

documents.description: Any documents related to the plan of this initiation

implementation.title: Implementation
implementation.description: Information related to the implementation of the contract in accordance with the obligations laid out therein.

rationale.title: Rationale
rationale.description: The rationale for the procurement provided in free text. More detail can be provided in an attached document.

documents.title: Documents
documents.description: A list of documents related to the planning process.

milestones.title: Planning milestones
milestones.description: A list of milestones associated with the planning stage.

forecasts.title: Forecasts
forecasts.description: Any forecasts metrics for this results of this contracting process.

project.title: Project information
project.description: The project section can be used to describe the relationship between this contracting process and a project or programme of work.

PreQualification.title: Pre-qualification
PreQualification.description: Data regarding pre-qualification process - limiting the number of qualified bidders by reviewing each bidder's qualifications against a set of criteria.

id.title: Pre-qualification ID
id.description: An identifier for this pre-qualification process. This may be the same as the ocid, or may be drawn from an internally held identifier for this process.

description.title: Pre-qualification description
description.description: Pre-qualification description

status.title: Pre-qualification status
status.description: The current status of the pre-qualification based on the preQualificationStatus codelist.

submissionMethod.title: Submission method
submissionMethod.description: Specify the method by which bids must be submitted, in person, written, or electronic auction. Using the [submission method codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/latest/en/schema/codelists/#submission-method)

submissionMethodDetails.title: Submission method details
submissionMethodDetails.description: Any detailed or further information on the submission method. This may include the address, e-mail address or online service to which bids should be submitted, and any special requirements to be followed for submissions.

period.title: Pre-qualification period
period.description: The period when the pre-qualification is open for submissions. The end date is the closing date for pre-qualification submissions.

enquiryPeriod.title: Enquiry period
enquiryPeriod.description: The period during which enquiries regarding the pre-qualification may be made and answered.

hasEnquiries.title: Has enquiries?
hasEnquiries.description: A true/false field to indicate whether any enquiries were received during the pre-qualification process

eligibilityCriteria.title: Eligibility criteria
eligibilityCriteria.description: A description of any eligibility criteria for bidders to participate in the pre-qualification.

qualificationPeriod.title: Qualification period
qualificationPeriod.description: The date or period when candidates will are anticipated to be qualified or pre-selected (shortlisted).

numberOfTenderers.title: Number of tenderers
numberOfTenderers.description: The number of entities who submit a response to the pre-qualification.

tenderers.title: Tenderers
tenderers.description: All entities who submit a response to the pre-qualification.

procuringEntity.title: Procuring entity
procuringEntity.description: The entity managing the procurement, which may be different from the buyer who is paying / using the items being procured.

documents.title: Documents
documents.description: All documents and attachments related to the pre-qualification, including any notices. See the [documentType codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/latest/en/schema/codelists/#document-type) for details of potential documents to include.

milestones.title: Milestones
milestones.description: A list of milestones associated with the pre-qualification.

amendments.description: An amendment is a formal change to the pre-qualification process, and generally involves the publication of a new RFQ notice/release. The rationale and a description of the changes made can be provided here.
amendments.title: Amendments

Tender.title: Tender
Tender.description: Data regarding tender process - publicly inviting prospective contractors to submit bids for evaluation and selecting a winner or winners.

id.description: An identifier for this tender process. This may be the same as the ocid, or may be drawn from an internally held identifier for this tender.

internalId.description: An internal identifier of this tender process drawn from an internally held identifier for this tender.

procurementMethod.description: open/selective depending on natur eof this initiation

id.description: ID for this release

internalId.description: Internal identifier for this PCR according to Procuring Entity classification

description.description: Free-text relevant description for this PCR

status.description: Status of PCR from [Codelists#PCR statuses|codelist] according to state-chart diagram

procurementMethodModalities.description: The set of modalities for this PCR

procurementMethodDetails.description: The machine-readable name of the initiated process

procurementMethodRationale.description: Free-text justification of applied procurement method by Procuring Entity

mainProcurementCategory.description: Main procurement category indicated according to the classification of the subject of procurement

tenderPeriod.description: The period for submission of the pre-award catalogues by invited suppliers

enquiryPeriod.description: The period for enquiries from invited suppliers

procuringEntity.description: Reference to the entity resonsible for this PCR

documents.description: Any documents attached to this PCR by PE

classification.description: Classification of group of goods requested by this PCR under current category. Usually it is a certain group detailed up to 6th CPV digit - code of one of nodes of establishment

node.description: Nodes are certain groups of goods described by Procuring Entity under particular category, classified with 6th digit of CPV

position.description: Positions - number of specific positions (known in advance), related to one or more profiles described under this PCR and expected to be proposed by invited suppliers with actual unit prices and conditions of delivery by submitting their pre-award catalogues

profile.description: Profiles - are varieties defined by Procuring Entity for this node together with related targets and criteria under specific pre-award catalogue request

id.title: Tender ID
id.description: An identifier for this tender process. This may be the same as the ocid

internalId.description: An internal identifier of this tender process drawn from an internally held identifier for this tender.

description.title: Tender description
description.description: Tender description

status.title: Tender status
status.description: The current status of the tender based on the [tenderStatus codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/#tender-status)
