procurementMethodModalities.title: Procurement method modalities
procurementMethodModalities.description: The modalities of the procurement method.

items.title: Items to be procured
items.description: The goods and services to be purchased, broken into line items wherever possible. Items should not be duplicated, but a quantity of 2 specified instead.

value.title: Value
value.description: The total upper estimated value of the procurement. A negative value indicates that the contracting process may involve payments from the supplier to the buyer (commonly used in concession contracts).

procurementMethod.title: Procurement method
procurementMethod.description: Specify tendering method against the [method codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/#method) as per [GPA definitions](http://www.wto.org/english/docs_e/legal_e/rev-gpr-94_01_e.htm) of Open, Selective, Limited

procurementMethodDetails.title: Procurement method details
procurementMethodDetails.description: Additional detail on the procurement method used. This field may be used to provide the local name of the particular procurement method used.

procurementMethodRationale.title: Procurement method rationale
procurementMethodRationale.description: Rationale of procurement method, especially in the case of Limited tendering.

mainProcurementCategory.title: Procurement category
mainProcurementCategory.description: The primary category describing the object of this contracting process from the [procurementCategory](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/#procurement-category) codelist (e.g. supplies, works, services, consultingServices or mixed).

awardCriteria.title: Award criteria
awardCriteria.description: Specify the award criteria for the procurement, using the [award criteria codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/#award-criteria)

awardCriteriaDetails.title: Award criteria details
awardCriteriaDetails.description: Any detailed or further information on the award or selection criteria.

submissionMethod.title: Submission method
submissionMethod.description: Specify the method by which bids must be submitted, in person, written, or electronic auction. Using the [submission method codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/#submission-method)

submissionMethodDetails.title: Submission method details
submissionMethodDetails.description: Any detailed or further information on the submission method. This may include the address, e-mail address or online service to which bids should be submitted, and any special requirements to be followed for submissions.

tenderPeriod.title: Tender period
tenderPeriod.description: The period when the tender is open for submissions. The end date is the closing date for tender submissions.

enquiryPeriod.title: Enquiry period
enquiryPeriod.description: The period during which potential bidders may submit questions and requests for clarification to the entity managing procurement. Details of how to submit enquiries should be provided in attached notices, or in submissionMethodDetails. Structured dates for when responses to questions will be made can be provided using tender milestones.

enquiries.title: Enquiries
enquiries.description: Questions sent to the procuring entity, and the answers given

hasEnquiries.title: Has enquiries?
hasEnquiries.description: A true/false field to indicate whether any enquiries were received during the tender process. Structured information on enquiries that were received, and responses to them, can be provided using the enquiries extension.

eligibilityCriteria.title: Eligibility criteria
eligibilityCriteria.description: A description of any eligibility criteria for potential suppliers.

awardPeriod.title: Evaluation and award period
awardPeriod.description: The period for adjudication and selection of the contract award. The end date should be the date on which an award is due to be finalised. The start date may be used to indicate the start of an evaluation period.

contractPeriod.description: The period over which the contract is estimated or required to be active. If the tender does not specify explicit dates, the duration field may be used.
contractPeriod.title: Contract period

numberOfTenderers.title: Number of tenderers
numberOfTenderers.description: The number of entities who submit a tender.

tenderers.title: Tenderers
tenderers.description: All entities who submit a bid on a tender. More detailed information on bids and the bidding organisation can be provided using the optional bid extension.

procuringEntity.title: Procuring entity
procuringEntity.description: The entity managing the procurement, which may be different from the buyer who is paying / using the items being procured.

documents.title: Documents
documents.description: All documents and attachments related to the tender, including any notices. See the [documentType codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/#document-type) for details of potential documents to include.

milestones.title: Milestones
milestones.description: A list of milestones associated with the tender.

amendments.description: A tender amendment is a formal change to the tender, and generally involves the publication of a new tender notice/release. The rationale and a description of the changes made can be provided here.
amendments.title: Amendments

lots.title: Lots
lots.description: A tender process may be divided into lots, where bidders can bid on one or more lots. Details of each lot can be provided here. Items, documents and other features can then reference the lot they are related to using relatedLot. Where no relatedLot identifier is given, the values should be interpreted as applicable to the whole tender. Properties of tender can be overridden for a given Lot through their inclusion in the Lot object.

lotGroups.title: Lot groups
lotGroups.description: Where the buyer reserves the right to combine lots, or wishes to specify the total value for a group of lots, a lot group is used to capture this information.

participationFees.title: Participation fees
participationFees.description: Any fees applicable to bidders wishing to participate in the tender process. Fees may apply for access to bidding documents, for the submission of bids or there may be a win fee payable by the successful bidder.

criteria.description: A list of criteria on which either bidders or items will be judged, evaluated or assessed.

classification.title: Classification
classification.description: The primary classification for the tender. Required by the EU. Uses CPV Codelist See the [itemClassificationScheme](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/#item-classification-scheme).

reviewPeriod.title: Review period
reviewPeriod.description: The period during which the decision of the procuring entity to award a contract can be challenged.

standstillPeriod.title: Standstill period
standstillPeriod.description: The duration of the applicable standstill period following a challenge or appeal of decisions or actions taken by the procuring entity that are allegedly not in compliance with the provisions of the Law

submissionLanguages.title: Submission Languages
submissionLanguages.description: Language(s) in which tenderers may submit, drawn from the [submissionLanguages codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/#submission-languages)

targets.title: Targets
targets.description: Any target metrics for this results of this contracting process.

auctionPeriod.title: Auction period
auctionPeriod.description: General auction period for the contracting process

procurementMethodModalitiesDetails.title: Procurement Method Modalities Details
procurementMethodModalitiesDetails.description: The prescribed presets of settings and adjustments for the differement procurement methods modalities applied under this contracting process

electronicAuction.title: Electronic Auction Modalities
electronicAuction.description: The prescribed presets of settings and adjustments available for the electronic auction as one one of the procurement methods modalities applied under this contracting process

conversions.title: Conversions
conversions.description: A list of weightings for the used criteria or applicable options

complaints.title: Comlaints
complaints.description: Any comlaints related to this tender

recurrence.title: Recurrence
recurrence.description: Information on the recurrence of the contracting process.

coveredBy.title: Covered by
coveredBy.description: The treaties, laws, regulations or other instruments that the contracting process is covered by.

ReviewProceedings.title: Review Proceedings
ReviewProceedings.description: General information related to reviews under this contracting process together with collected complaints and reviews

complaints.title: Complaints
complaints.description: Complaints to the conditions and decisions

reviews.title: Reviews
reviews.description: Review Procedures conducted due to complaints received

Award.title: Award
Award.description: An award for the given procurement. There may be more than one award per contracting process e.g. because the contract is split amongst different providers, or because it is a standing offer.

description.description: Where contract award notice is unsucclessful - the reason should be sepcified here (based on predefined systems' values)

value.description: open/selective depending on natur eof this initiation

id.title: Award ID
id.description: The identifier for this award. It must be unique and cannot change within the Open Contracting Process it is part of (defined by a single ocid). See the [identifier guidance](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/identifiers/) for further details.

description.title: Description
description.description: Award description

status.title: Award status
status.description: The current status of the award drawn from the [awardStatus codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/#award-status)

date.title: Award date
date.description: The date of the contract award. This is usually the date on which a decision to award was made.

value.title: Value
value.description: The total value of this award. In the case of a framework contract this may be the total estimated lifetime value, or maximum value, of the agreement. There may be more than one award per procurement. A negative value indicates that the award may involve payments from the supplier to the buyer (commonly used in concession contracts).

suppliers.title: Suppliers
suppliers.description: The suppliers awarded this award. If different suppliers have been awarded different items of values, these should be split into separate award blocks.

items.title: Items awarded
items.description: The goods and services awarded in this award, broken into line items wherever possible. Items should not be duplicated, but the quantity specified instead.

contractPeriod.title: Contract period
contractPeriod.description: The period for which the contract has been awarded.

documents.title: Documents
documents.description: All documents and attachments related to the award, including any notices.

amendments.description: An award amendment is a formal change to the details of the award, and generally involves the publication of a new award notice/release. The rationale and a description of the changes made can be provided here.
amendments.title: Amendments

relatedLots.title: Related lot(s)
relatedLots.description: If this award relates to one or more specific lots, provide the identifier(s) of the related lot(s) here.

complaints.title: Comlaints
complaints.description: Any comlaints related to this award

statusDetails.title: Status details
statusDetails.description: Additional details of an award status.

agreedMetrics.title: Agreed metrics
agreedMetrics.description: Any target metrics set out as part of the contract award.

relatedBid.title: Related Bid
relatedBid.description: Where bid details are used, a cross reference to the entry in the bids array to which this award relates. Provide the bid identifier here

Contract.title: Contract
Contract.description: Information regarding the signed contract between the buyer and supplier(s).

description.description: Where contract award notice is unsucclessful - the reason should be sepcified here (based on predefined systems' values)

id.title: Contract ID
id.description: The identifier for this contract. It must be unique and cannot change within its Open Contracting Process (defined by a single ocid). See the [identifier guidance](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/identifiers/) for further details.

awardID.title: Award ID
awardID.description: The award.id against which this contract is being issued.

extendsContractID.title: Extends contract ID
extendsContractID.description: If this contract extends or amends a previously issued contract, then the contract.id value for the extended/amended contract can be provided here.

description.title: Contract description
description.description: Contract description

status.title: Contract status
status.description: The current status of the contract. Drawn from the [contractStatus codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/#contract-status)

period.title: Period
period.description: The start and end date for the contract.

value.title: Value
value.description: The total value of this contract. A negative value indicates that the contract will involve payments from the supplier to the buyer (commonly used in concession contracts).

items.title: Items contracted
items.description: The goods, services, and any intangible outcomes in this contract. Note: If the items are the same as the award do not repeat.

dateSigned.title: Date signed
dateSigned.description: The date the contract was signed. In the case of multiple signatures, the date of the last signature.

documents.title: Documents
documents.description: All documents and attachments related to the contract, including any notices.

implementation.title: Implementation
implementation.description: Information related to the implementation of the contract in accordance with the obligations laid out therein.

relatedProcesses.description: If this process is followed by one or more contracting processes, represented under a separate open contracting identifier (ocid) then details of the related process can be provided here. This is commonly used to point to subcontracts, or to renewal and replacement processes for this contract.
relatedProcesses.title: Related processes

milestones.title: Contract milestones
milestones.description: A list of milestones associated with the finalisation of this contract.

amendments.description: A contract amendment is a formal change to, or extension of, a contract, and generally involves the publication of a new contract notice/release, or some other documents detailing the change. The rationale and a description of the changes made can be provided here.
amendments.title: Amendments

isFrameworkOrDynamic.title: Is Framework Or Dynamic?
isFrameworkOrDynamic.description: Contracts within a framework agreement or a dynamic purchasing system are being awarded. Required by the EU

agreedMetrics.title: Agreed metrics
agreedMetrics.description: Any target metrics set out as part of the contract documents.

Project.title: Project information
Project.description: A project or programme of work.

id.title: Project identifier
id.description: An externally provided identifier for the project. This might be drawn from a projects register, or may be based on the canonical version of a project name. Project IDs should be unique to a publisher. URIs can be used.

title.title: Project title
title.description: The name of the project to which this contracting process relates. Some organizations maintain a registry of projects, and the data should use the name by which the project is known in that registry.

description.title: Project description
description.description: A short free text description of the project.

totalValue.title: Total project value
totalValue.description: The total anticipated value of the project over it's lifetime.

uri.title: Linked project information
uri.description: A URI pointing to further information about this project.

sector.title: Project sector
sector.description: A high-level categorization of the main sector this procurement process relates to. Use of [UN COFOG codes](https://unstats.un.org/unsd/publications/catalogue?selectID=145), with 'COFOG' as the classification scheme, and the numerical COFOG code is recommended for the primary sector classification.

additionalClassifications.title: Additional sector classifications
additionalClassifications.description: Additional project classification, by other sector classifications, or using other classification schemes (e.g. against a strategic framework).

locations.title: Project location
locations.description: Information about the location where a project is taking place.
